maqras.text: When the sky splits asunder
And responds to its Lord, and it is bound [to respond]
And when the earth is levelled
And it throws out its contents, and becomes void
And responds to its Lord, and it is bound [to respond]
O human! You do indeed have to put in hard labour to go to your Lord, and then you meet Him
And as for him whose book of deeds is placed in his right hand
He will then face his accounting with ease
And he will turn to his own people in joy
And as for him whose book of deeds is given to him behind his back
He will pray for [his own death and] destruction
And he will burn in blazing Fire
He had indeed been living happily engrossed [on earth] among people of his own kind
He had indeed thought he would never return [to life]
Yes indeed! His Lord had kept a watch over him
But no! [He shall not continue to remain dead.] I swear by the afterglow of sunset
And by the night, and what it veils in its darkness
And by the moon, at its full
You [humans] do move from stage to stage
Then how come they believe not [in a life to come]
And when the Qur'aan is read out to them, they prostrate not
On the contrary, they who suppress the truth dny it [this divine writ]
And Allah knows what they keep to themselves
So give them the prospect of grievous suffering [in the life to come]
But not to those who believe and do good deeds. For them is there a reward unending
By the sky, with its constellations of stars
And by the Day [of Judgment] promised
And witness [giving evidence in favour of or against anything on the Judgment Day] and those for or against whom the witness is giving evidence
Damned are the owners of the ditc
Of the fuel-filled fire
When they sat by it
And witnessed what they did to the believers
And they took vengeance on them for nothing else but that they believed in Allah, the Omnipotent, the Embodiment of Praise
To Whom belongs the Absolute Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is Witness to all things
Surely indeed, those who persecute believing men and believing women and repent not — for them will be the punishment of Hell, and for them the punishment by the Fire
Surely indeed, those who believe and do good deeds — for them will be Gardens underneath which rivers flow. That is the Greatest Success
Indeed, the Hold of your Lord is certainly severe
It is He indeed Who does the original creation, and Who is capable of resurrecting His original creation when it is dead
And He is the One Forgiving, Loving
Lord of the Glorious Throne
HE does what He wills
Have you come to know the story of the armies
Of Pharaoh and of (the ancient tribe of) Thamood
Yet, [despite knowing the story of how those ancient peoples were destroyed for their transgressions] those that suppress the Truth live in denial
And Allah surrounds them unawares
Nay, [non-believers' denial notwithstanding,] this is a glorious Qur'an
In a well-protected format
By the sky and the Taariq
— And what do you understand what the Taariq is
It is the shining star —
Not a soul but has a protector over it
Let man then see how he is created
He is created by means of fluid [blood] spurting
Out from between the spine and the ribs
It [blood] is certainly indeed capable of its return
The Day secrets are disclosed
For him [man] there will then be no power, and no helper
By the sky, ever returning [revolving]
And by the earth with its surface cracking open again and again with new growth of plants and vegetation
It [Qur'aan] is indeed a decisive Word
And it is not for just sport and amusement
They [suppressors of Truth] are indeed hatching a plot
And I [Allah] am devising a plot
So let those who suppress the Truth go their way; let them go for a little while
